org.eclipselabs.emfpath.operation
Class EAdd

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipselabs.emfpath.operation.EAdd
Direct Known Subclasses:
EAdd.Function
public abstract class EAdd
extends java.lang.Object

A function taking an EObject as input and returning the same EObject as output after having added a value to the feature specified when creating it.

Usage:

EAdd.toFeature(EcorePackage.Literals.ECLASS__ESTRUCTURAL_FEATURES).value(anEStructuralFeatureObject).of(anEObject);

As a function, it can be used to transform an iterable or iterator with Iterables.transform(Iterable, Function) or Iterators.transform(Iterator, Function)

Usage:

EAdd eAdd = EAdd.toFeature(EcorePackage.Literals.ECLASS__ESTRUCTURAL_FEATURES).value(anEStructuralFeatureObject);
Iterables res = Iterables.transform(anEClassIterable, eAdd);

In the previous example, res and anEClassIterable are two different iterables which can iterate on the same set of value.

Since:
0.1.0
Author:
MikaÃ«l barbero

Method Detail

toFeature

public static EAdd toFeature(java.lang.String eStructuralFeatureName)
Instantiates and return a EAdd function that will be able to add a value to the feature named eStructuralFeature. The corresponding feature must be many valued.

Note that if you are applying this EAdd.Function to an Iterable the corresponding feature will be retrieved for each element of this Iterable. This can lead to an undesired performance overhead.

Instead, you should use the toFeature(EStructuralFeature) static method to avoid this repeated retrieving.

Parameters:
eStructuralFeatureName - the name of the feature to which we will add an object
Returns:
a function on which you have to call value(Object) method to specify the value to add to the feature named eStructuralFeature
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eStructuralFeatureName is null or an empty String
Since:
0.1.0

toFeature

public static EAdd toFeature(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature eStructuralFeature)
Instantiates and return a EAdd function that will be able to add a value to the eStructuralFeature. This feature must be many valued.

Note that if you are applying this EAdd.Function to an Iterable, all the EObject in this Iterable must have this very feature owned by their EClass. For instance, if two objects a and b both have a feature named contents from two distinct class, the result of applying this function with the feature from a.eClass() or b.eClass() is undetermined.

Parameters:
eStructuralFeature - the feature to which we will add an object
Returns:
a function on which you have to call value(Object) method to specify the value to add to the eStructuralFeature
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eStructuralFeature is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eStructuralFeature is not many valued.
Since:
0.1.0

value

public EAdd.Function value(java.lang.Object newValue)
Configure this object to add the newValue to the feature of the EObject on which this function will be applied.

Parameters:
newValue - the value to add to the feature as specified by the static generator methods.
Returns:
this object to allow chained calls.
Since:
0.1.0
